risks.title: Optimize Bedrock AI inference costs
risks.impact: Paying more than necessary for AI inference
risks.finding: The architecture uses AWS Bedrock for AI analysis, which can be costly at $0.001/review and $0.012/image. There may be opportunities to optimize these costs.
risks.remediation: Consider using AWS Lambda with custom ML models or Amazon Comprehend for more cost-effective text analysis. For image analysis, evaluate Amazon Rekognition which may be more cost-effective than Bedrock Sonnet.

risks.title: Optimize Neo4j AuraDB latency
risks.impact: Slower response times due to database latency
risks.finding: The architecture uses Neo4j AuraDB with async background writes, which can introduce 200-500ms of latency. This may impact overall response times.
risks.remediation: Consider using Amazon Neptune for a more performant graph database service with lower latency. Alternatively, evaluate caching frequently accessed data in Amazon ElastiCache to reduce database load.

risks.title: Implement failover for Bedrock AI
risks.impact: Degraded user experience if Bedrock is unavailable
risks.finding: The architecture has a graceful fallback to pattern matching if Bedrock is unavailable, but this may not provide the same level of analysis quality.
risks.remediation: Implement a failover mechanism to use an alternative AI service (e.g., Amazon Comprehend, Amazon Rekognition) if Bedrock is unavailable. This will ensure a consistent user experience.

summary: The architecture is well-designed and follows many AWS best practices. However, there are opportunities to optimize costs for AI inference, reduce database latency, and improve reliability by implementing failover for the Bedrock AI service.
architecture_description: Next.js 14 frontend deployed on Vercel with server components and edge caching. TypeScript strict mode for full type safety. FastAPI backend on Railway with Python 3.11 and async request handling. AWS Bedrock for AI analysis using Claude 3.5 Haiku with inference profile (~$0.001/review) and Claude 3 Sonnet for image vision analysis (~$0.012/image). Inline AWS Well-Architected context (~6K tokens) passed with every request, no Knowledge Base retrieval. Neo4j AuraDB free tier knowledge graph with async background writes (non-blocking, 200-500ms latency). Graph stores 31 reviews, 20 AWS services, 72 findings with relationships (HAS_FINDING, INVOLVES_SERVICE, CO_OCCURS_WITH). HTTPS everywhere with TLS 1.3. CORS whitelist for tesseric.ca and api.tesseric.ca origins only. IAM roles for AWS Bedrock access, no hardcoded access keys. Environment variables stored in Railway secrets. GitHub Actions CI/CD with pytest backend tests and TypeScript compilation checks. Docker containerization for backend with multi-stage builds. Pydantic v2 for request/response validation. Zero data persistence for architecture descriptions (ephemeral sessions, immediate discard). Metrics endpoint with 5-minute caching. Processing time tracking in Neo4j Analysis nodes. Average response time 8.0 seconds. Graceful fallback to pattern matching if Bedrock unavailable.
